latest news.eng_title: Trump Vows to Fire Military Officials Responsible for Afghanistan Withdrawal
latest news.summary: Former US President and presidential candidate Donald Trump has vowed to fire military officials responsible for the failed withdrawal of US forces from Afghanistan. Trump said at a crowded rally in North Carolina: 'I will demand the resignation of every senior military official involved in the catastrophe in Afghanistan, they should resign immediately.' In February 2022, President Joe Biden rejected the findings of a military investigation, which concluded that 'his administration failed to prepare and respond adequately to the Taliban's takeover of power in Afghanistan.' Biden said: 'I reject those narratives,' adding: 'There was no good time to leave, but if we hadn't left, we would have had to - as they acknowledged - send more troops to hell.' He explained that 'his administration would have had to significantly increase the number of troops and thus return to this war of attrition... Therefore, this decision (to withdraw) was the most wise decision to be made.' The investigation, published by The Washington Post under the Freedom of Information Act, found that attempts by US military leaders to plan the evacuation of embassy staff and Afghan allies were met with resistance in the White House and the State Department. It is worth noting that in August 2021, the Taliban intensified its attacks on the Afghan government forces and entered the capital Kabul on August 15, 2021. Under the cover of night on August 31, the US military began to leave Kabul, marking the end of nearly 20 years of US military presence in the country. In early September of the same year, the Taliban formed a new government in Afghanistan.
latest news.title: ترامب يتوعد بإقالة المسؤولين عن انسحاب القوات الأمريكية من أفغانستان

latest news.eng_title: ‘Back Pay and Apology': Trump Vows To Rehire Military Members Fired For Refusing COVID Shots
latest news.summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has vowed to rehire thousands of military service members who were fired for refusing the COVID-19 vaccine mandate and promised they would receive an apology with back pay. Trump stated, 'I will rehire every patriot that was fired with an apology and back pay. They will get their back pay and an apology from our government.' As of October 2023, only 43 of the fired 8,000 service members have rejoined the military following the repeal of the vaccine mandate. Trump also criticized the Biden-Harris administration's handling of the military and its morale, saying, 'Thanks to Comrade Kamala and Joe Biden, morale in our military is now so low that almost every single branch is suffering a major recruitment and retention crisis.' He promised to begin the biggest peacetime recruitment drive in the history of armed forces and called for mass resignations of top military officials behind the chaotic 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal.
latest news.title: ‘Back Pay and Apology': Trump Vows To Rehire Military Members Fired For Refusing COVID Shots

latest news.eng_title: RFK Jr. Preparing to End Presidential Campaign and Endorse Trump: Sources
latest news.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is reportedly preparing to end his 2024 presidential campaign and endorse Donald Trump, according to sources. A campaign insider suggested that Kennedy could announce the end of his campaign during a speech in Phoenix, Arizona on Friday, where Trump is also holding a rally. Kennedy's running mate Nicole Shanahan previously suggested that they could drop out of the race to endorse Trump in a bid to secure a position in a potential Trump administration. The insider proposed that Trump offer Kennedy a major position in his administration, such as HHS Secretary or Attorney General, in exchange for the endorsement. Kennedy's campaign manager Amaryllis Kennedy acknowledged that the campaign's impact is confined to its effect on the two frontrunners, saying 'Any path forward changes the outcome.' A spokesperson for the Trump campaign did not respond to a request for comment. Kennedy is expected to share an update on the fate of his campaign by Friday.
latest news.title: RFK Jr. Preparing to End Presidential Campaign and Endorse Trump: Sources

latest news.eng_title: Is This the Issue Unifying the RFK Jr. and Trump Campaigns?
latest news.summary: RFK Jr. is reportedly set to drop out of the 2024 presidential race and endorse former President Trump. According to Nicole Shanahan, RFK Jr.'s vice presidential candidate, the decision is driven by efforts by Democrats to handicap their campaign with lawsuits, which they believe 'bankrupt the underpinnings of democracy.' The campaigns appear to be unified against a Harris administration, with Shanahan expressing opposition to Vice President Kamala Harris becoming President Harris and sounding the alarm about her economic proposals, which she claims are similar to those that caused famine in Mao's Communist China. As Nicole Shanahan said, 'What the Democrats consider common course to win elections is...'
latest news.title: Is This the Issue Unifying the RFK Jr. and Trump Campaigns?

latest news.eng_title: The bitter Biden story could be baloney
latest news.summary: The Daily Beast and Politico have reported that Joe Biden's decision to leave the Democratic National Convention after the first night may be due to bitterness over how party officials pressured him to withdraw from the race. However, there is no concrete evidence to support this claim, and the sources cited by the publications are anonymous. Politico quotes 'three people familiar with Biden's thinking' and a 'senior White House official' who describe Biden's feelings towards party members, but the officials remain unnamed. The article suggests that these anonymous sources may be motivated by personal grievances, such as 'private irritation' over a recent story in The New Yorker. The author argues that if journalists are going to report on politicians' inner thoughts, they should reveal their sources to provide context and avoid speculation. Ultimately, the article concludes that questions about Biden's feelings towards party members will continue to be asked, but the answers will remain unclear.
latest news.title: The bitter Biden story could be baloney

latest news.summary: Former President Donald Trump has made significant changes to his 2024 presidential campaign by re-appointing key figures from his 2016 team, including Corey Lewandowski, and intensifying debate preparations. Lewandowski, who previously managed Trump's successful 2016 campaign, will return alongside other experienced Trump campaign veterans. Trump's campaign is also focusing on debate preparations, working with former Democrat Tulsi Gabbard to refine his debating strategy against Vice President Kamala Harris. According to reports, Trump blames his campaign staff for the decline in his previously larger lead over President Joe Biden. Trump's campaign adjustments and strategic hires reflect his determination to consolidate his position in a closely contested race.
latest news.title: Trump conducts main campaign alterations

latest news.eng_title: Donald Trump's Campaign Has Fired Back At NBA Coach Steve Kerr
latest news.summary: Golden State Warriors head coach Steve Kerr delivered a speech at the 2024 Democratic National Convention, urging voters to elect Vice President Kamala Harris. Kerr took a jab at Republican nominee Donald Trump, saying 'Night Night' in a reference to Steph Curry's sleeping gesture. The Trump campaign fired back, criticizing Kerr for his past comments on China, saying he had 'no comment' when asked about human rights abuses. This is not the first time Trump has gone after Kerr, who he previously called 'scared like a little boy' for not criticizing China. The general election is in two-and-a-half months, so it remains to be seen if there will be more back-and-forths between Kerr and Trump.
latest news.title: Donald Trump's Campaign Has Fired Back At NBA Coach Steve Kerr

latest news.eng_title: All that applause for Biden was also for his decision to quit the race
latest news.summary: President Biden's decision to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race has been met with praise from his supporters, who see it as a selfless act that will allow his party to move forward with a new nominee, Vice President Kamala Harris. According to Michael D. Brown, a member of the US Senate shadow delegates, Biden's decision was a 'sacrifice' that showed he 'cares more about the people than he cares about himself.' However, others have questioned Biden's motivations, with Anita Dunn, his longtime adviser, attributing his change of heart to '24 days of unremitting negative, horrible attacks on Joe Biden.' Representative Nancy Pelosi said she hasn't had a conversation with Biden about his decision, but expressed her support for it, saying 'He made the decision for the country.' Representative Seth Moulton, who was one of the first lawmakers to call for Biden to withdraw, praised Biden's decision, saying 'This is an extraordinary time in American political history... Democrats have a new lease on life, not just with the presidential ticket but with every race up and down the ballot.'
latest news.title: All that applause for Biden was also for his decision to quit the race

latest news.summary: The 2024 presidential election is often perceived as being focused on 'vibes' and celebrity endorsements, but it is actually a policy-heavy contest. The Democratic National Convention has seen several high-profile speakers, including President Joe Biden, who passed the torch to Vice President Kamala Harris. Harris has been criticized for not having her own policy proposals, but she has outlined an economic platform that draws from progressive populism. The Democratic platform also refers to Biden's 'second term,' indicating that the party is still adjusting to his withdrawal from the race. Meanwhile, the Trump campaign has been trying to tie Harris to a bundle of right-wing policy proposals known as 'Project 2025,' which has been repudiated by the former president himself. However, six of Trump's former Cabinet secretaries and 140 people who worked in his administration were involved in writing the plan. Michigan state Sen. Mallory McMorrow accused the plan's authors of scheming to replace career executive branch workers with Trump loyalists and potentially turning the FBI into Trump's own police force. 'That is not how it works in America,' she said. 'That's how it works in dictatorships.'
latest news.title: The 2024 Race Is Policy-Heavy, Actually.

latest news.eng_title: Trump complains it's "not fair" that he has to face Kamala Harris instead of Joe Biden
latest news.summary: Former President Donald Trump is complaining that he has to face Vice President Kamala Harris instead of President Joe Biden in the election, claiming that the Democrats 'staged the first ever 'Coup' in America' and that Biden was 'fired' from the race. Trump has repeatedly used similar language, calling the situation a 'coup of a president' and claiming that the Democrats are a 'threat to democracy.' However, experts warn that Trump's rhetoric is setting up the 'next version of 'Stop the Steal,' a movement that pushed false claims of election fraud after the 2020 election. 'They're latching on to this, that what the Democrats just did, that's a coup,' said former Rep. Joe Walsh, R-Ill., adding that Trump's supporters believe it. 'This is what I hear all day. That was the attack on democracy. That's what they're going to do to push back on the legitimate charge that Trump tried to overthrow an election four years ago.'
latest news.title: Trump complains it's "not fair" that he has to face Kamala Harris instead of Joe Biden

news knowledge.eng_title: Will Donald Trump Fire His Campaign Manager? Crypto Bettors Think It's Close To 50-50 After Bringing On Corey Lewandowski
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump's recent addition of former campaign manager Corey Lewandowski to his team has sparked speculation about potential leadership changes. According to a Polymarket, there is a 47% chance that Trump will fire his campaign manager before the November election. Trump has publicly expressed support for his current campaign leadership, stating, 'Susie is fantastic, as you know. And Chris is fantastic. They are leading it.' However, the Polymarket prediction suggests that there is still a significant possibility of changes in campaign leadership. The addition of experienced campaign veterans, particularly those with a history of loyalty to Trump, may be seen as an attempt to reinvigorate the campaign as it faces fundraising challenges and competitive polling in key swing states.
news knowledge.title: Will Donald Trump Fire His Campaign Manager? Crypto Bettors Think It's Close To 50-50 After Bringing On Corey Lewandowski

news knowledge.eng_title: Donald Trump Shakes Up Campaign Team as Kamala Harris' Polling Surges
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump has brought in new members to his 2024 campaign team, including Corey Lewandowski, who was previously fired as Trump's 2016 campaign manager after being accused of assaulting a reporter. The move comes as Vice President Kamala Harris continues to lead Trump in the polls, with a 4-point lead in the latest Emerson College poll and a 2.9-point lead in FiveThirtyEight's national average tracker. Trump's campaign managers, Susie Wiles and Chris LaCivita, said in a statement that the new additions will help Trump 'prosecute the case against Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, the most radical ticket in American history.' However, the Democratic National Committee's rapid response director, Alex Floyd, responded by saying that Trump is 'surrounding himself with people who share his values—namely crooks, convicts, and creeps.' Trump was also asked about his campaign strategy of launching personal attacks on Harris, and he said, 'I think I am entitled to personal attacks. I don't have a lot of respect for her. I don't have a lot of respect for her intelligence, and I think she'll be a terrible president.'
news knowledge.title: Donald Trump Shakes Up Campaign Team as Kamala Harris' Polling Surges

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump Is Pissed at Harris for Trapping Him in Two Debates
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump's presidential campaign has hired Corey Lewandowski, a former campaign manager, as a senior adviser. Lewandowski's return has sparked speculation that he will replace campaign co-managers Chris LaCivita and Susie Wiles. A source close to Lewandowski said, 'It's like Trump just wants them to kill each other and for one to win so he doesn't have to actually fire anyone.' LaCivita's firm, Advanced Strategies, has invoiced $1.7 million from the Republican National Committee in 2024, surpassing last year's total of $1.65 million. Lewandowski denied rumors that he would conduct a forensic audit of the campaign and push LaCivita out, calling the rumors 'fake news.' Lewandowski's hiring signals Trump's desire to surround himself with those who agree with him and won't try to change him.
news knowledge.title: Trump Is Pissed at Harris for Trapping Him in Two Debates

news knowledge.eng_title: Trump Campaign Brings Back a Very Familiar Face for 2024 Homestretch
news knowledge.summary: Donald Trump has announced the return of his 2016 campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, as a senior adviser to his 2024 campaign. Lewandowski will join other new hires, including Tim Murtaugh, who was communications director on Trump's 2020 campaign, and Alex Pfeiffer, Alex Bruesewitz, and Taylor Budowich, who were working for the Trump-aligned super PAC MAGA Inc. Trump posted on Truth Social, 'We're leading in almost all Polls, in some cases leading by A LOT, despite the fact that the Fake News is pulling out all stops for their Radical Left San Francisco Liberal, Kamala Harris.' Trump's current co-campaign managers, Susie Wiles and Chris LaCivita, said in a statement, 'As we head into the home stretch of this election, we are continuing to add to our impressive campaign team, Corey Lewandowski, Taylor Budowich, Alex Pfeiffer, Alex Bruesewitz, and Tim Murtaugh are all veterans of prior Trump campaigns and their unmatched experience will help President Trump prosecute the case against Kamala Harris and Tim Walz.' LaCivita has a history of running negative campaigns, including the 'swift boat' campaign in 2004 against John Kerry.
news knowledge.title: Trump Campaign Brings Back a Very Familiar Face for 2024 Homestretch

news knowledge.eng_title: Fired Trump Campaign Manager Corey Lewandowski Returns as Adviser Amid Turmoil
news knowledge.summary: Former President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, is returning to the Trump campaign as an adviser, along with four other former Trump staffers. According to spokesperson Steven Cheung, Lewandowski will be joining the team 'as we head into the home stretch of this election.' The group includes Taylor Budowich, Alex Pfeiffer, Alex Bruesewitz, and Tim Murtaugh, all of whom have experience working on prior Trump campaigns. Their return comes amid turmoil in the campaign, with former Trump White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci claiming that Trump is 'lighting' his campaign staff up 'right now about picking Vance.' Trump has denied these claims, stating that he is 'thrilled' to have current campaign managers Susie Wiles and Chris LaCivita on his team. The move has sparked controversy, with Lewandowski's past controversies, including allegations of assaulting a reporter and making sexual advances, being cited as reasons for his return.
news knowledge.title: Fired Trump Campaign Manager Corey Lewandowski Returns as Adviser Amid Turmoil

news knowledge.eng_title: Donald Trump adds Corey Lewandowski, other longtime allies to 2024 campaign
news knowledge.summary: The Donald Trump campaign has expanded its staff with the addition of longtime allies, including Corey Lewandowski, Trump's first campaign manager in 2016, and Tim Murtaugh, communications director for Trump's 2020 campaign. Lewandowski and Trump have had an up-and-down relationship, with Lewandowski being fired as campaign manager in 2016 but remaining an informal adviser. The new hires come as Vice President Kamala Harris has erased Trump's polling lead over President Joe Biden, who withdrew from the race last month. The campaign stated that the new advisers 'will help President Trump prosecute the case against Kamala Harris and Tim Walz.'
news knowledge.title: Donald Trump adds Corey Lewandowski, other longtime allies to 2024 campaign

news knowledge.eng_title: Is Donald Trump exploring firing his campaign managers? What we know
news knowledge.summary: Rumors that Donald Trump is considering firing his campaign managers, Chris LaCivita and Susie Wiles, appear to have originated from a since changed online article and a quote from Anthony Scaramucci, a vocal critic of the former president. Scaramucci said on the podcast The Rest Is Politics U.S. that Trump was irate over the choice of Ohio Senator JD Vance as the Republican's 2024 running mate and had 'talked to people' about firing LaCivita and Wiles. However, Trump's communications director, Steven Cheung, denied the reports, stating that Trump is 'thrilled' with the choice of running mate and that any reporting to the contrary is 'ridiculous fake news.'
news knowledge.title: Is Donald Trump exploring firing his campaign managers? What we know

news knowledge.eng_title: Director Steps Down Amid Controversy: Project 2025 Faces Political Heat
news knowledge.summary: Paul Dans, the director of Project 2025, a conservative policymaking group, has resigned amid criticism from Democrats and complications for Donald Trump's presidential campaign. The group, known for advocating significant expansions of presidential power, has become a liability for Trump. Despite Trump's campaign distancing itself from Project 2025, co-campaign managers Chris LaCivita and Susie Wiles expressed relief at the potential end of the project. The Heritage Foundation, which organizes the initiative, confirmed Dans' departure without providing reasons. Project 2025 has drawn Democratic scrutiny and public backlash, turning into a symbol of the extreme political shift they associate with a potential Trump presidency.
news knowledge.title: Director Steps Down Amid Controversy: Project 2025 Faces Political Heat

news knowledge.eng_title: Project 2025 director quits due to Trump campaign pressure
news knowledge.summary: Paul Dans, the director of Project 2025, has resigned due to pressure from the Trump campaign, according to Roger Sollenberger of The Daily Beast. Dans led the initiative to create a far-right government under a conservative president, which includes plans to fire 50,000 career federal employees, restrict access to contraception, and implement a national abortion ban. Kevin Roberts, the president of the Heritage Foundation, stated that Dans will be 'departing the team' and moving on to 'the front where the fight remains.' Trump's campaign has denied any involvement with Project 2025, but the Kamala Harris campaign notes that Trump's backers drafted the project, and that it is 'on the ballot because Donald Trump is on the ballot.'
news knowledge.title: Project 2025 director quits due to Trump campaign pressure

news knowledge.eng_title: Project 2025 director forced out by Trump campaign manager: report
news knowledge.summary: Project 2025 director Paul Dans has stepped down from his position at the Heritage Foundation after former President Donald Trump's campaign leadership grew frustrated with the plan. According to internal emails obtained by The Daily Beast, Trump campaign manager Chris LaCivita went after Dans, and the team behind promoting the plan is being shut down. The plan, which outlines how a second Trump term would operate, has drawn massive attention and criticism for its proposals to slash federal government programs, eliminate the Department of Education, and replace government experts with conservative loyalists. Trump has tried to distance himself from the plan, but many of its architects are former Trump appointees, staff, or allies. As Daily Beast reporter Roger Sollenberger wrote, 'This suggests Project 2025 will likely shut down.'
news knowledge.title: Project 2025 director forced out by Trump campaign manager: report
